summary: A series of Bureau of Prisons clinical encounter notes for inmate Jeffrey Epstein from July 2019, documenting medical evaluations and injuries in the days leading up to his death. The records include notes on neck injuries, neurological symptoms, and his refusal to discuss how the injuries occurred, hinting at an altercation with his cellmate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of all medical records, being treated for various complaints including neck injuries, neuropathy, and chronic conditions while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: Conducted injury assessments on July 23 and 24, 2019, documenting Epstein's neck injuries and his insinuation that his cellmate was involved.

persons.name: SAD
persons.context: Made an amendment to a clinical note on July 26, 2019.

persons.name: Operational Lt
persons.context: Notified by medical staff about Epstein's statements regarding his injuries; requested the injury report on July 23, 2019.

connections.description: Epstein was under the medical care of Bureau of Prisons physicians who evaluated his chronic conditions and cosigned treatment notes.
Epstein was assessed by registered nurses for symptoms like neuropathy and numbness, with vital signs taken and follow-up plans made.
A mid-level provider conducted key injury assessments where Epstein insinuated his cellmate was involved in his neck injuries but refused to elaborate.
Custody staff, specifically an Operational Lieutenant, was notified by medical staff about Epstein's statements and requested the injury report.
Epstein insinuated to medical staff that his cellmate 'had to do with what happened to me' regarding the neck injuries, but refused to provide details.

events.title: Epstein Found with Neck Injury
events.description: Epstein was found in his cell in the Special Housing Unit with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor. He reported waking up 'snorting' and had circular erythema (redness) around his neck. He was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Insinuates Cellmate Involvement
events.description: During a medical follow-up, Epstein told an MLP, 'I think my room mate had to do with what happened to me,' but refused to say anything more about the neck injuries.

events.title: Epstein Reports Neurological Symptoms
events.description: Epstein reported to nursing staff that he woke up with no control over his right arm for a few minutes and later reported persistent 'pins and needles' in his right hand.

events.title: Chronic Care Evaluation
events.description: Epstein had a physician evaluation for chronic conditions including hypertriglyceridemia, sleep apnea, and severe spinal stenosis causing numbness and shooting pain.

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a rope around his neck and was placed on suicide watch.
On July 24, 2019, Epstein told a medical provider, 'I think my room mate had to do with what happened to me,' but refused to elaborate further.
Medical records document unexplained circular erythema (redness) and abrasions on Epstein's neck consistent with a ligature injury.
Epstein reported neurological symptoms on July 28, 2019, including loss of control over his right arm and persistent 'pins and needles'.
The records show medical staff notified custody (Operational Lt) about Epstein's statements and injuries, indicating internal reporting protocols were followed.
